title: Market report: Phone mast float sends positive signal
text:
African telecoms firm Helios Towers rose steadily upon its stock-market debut, despite market jitters that have seen several firms pull their initial public offering plans.

Shares in the infrastructure firm, which is incorporated in Mauritius and focused on sub-Saharan Africa, touched as high as 124p, closing the day up 5.65pc at 121.5p.

The group, which includes billionaire fund manager George Soros and from US secretary of state Madeleine Albright among its backers, floated at a conservative 115p, towards the lower end of its prospectus range.

The billion-share float gave the company a market value of £1.2bn, suggesting it may be on track to enter the FTSE 250 at the next index update in December....
description: African telecoms firm Helios Towers rose steadily upon its stock-market debut, despite market jitters that have seen several firms pull their initial public offering plans.
